trans-unit.source: Defines a single item of the project as it is passed into a task.
<xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskItem> objects do not exactly correspond to item elements in project files.
If they did, then tasks would have access to data that was not explicitly passed into the task through the project file.
This is not a security issue, but rather an issue with project file clarity and transparency.
This class has to be sealed since the build engine instantiates its own copy of this type.
If a third party were to extend this class, then the build engine will yield an undesired behavior.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskItem"></xref> class.
This constructor enables this type to be COM-creatable.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskItem"></xref> class using the specified source <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem"></xref>.
The item to copy.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskItem"></xref> class using the specified item-specification string.
The item specification.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskItem"></xref> class using the specified item-specification string and its metadata.
The item specification.
The custom metadata for the item specification.
Clones the collection of custom metadata for the item specification.
This method does not include built-in metadata.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that represents a clone of the custom metadata.
Copies the item-specification metadata to the specified destination task item.
If the metadata already exists on the destination item, then it is not overwritten.
The original metadata value supersedes the copied metadata value.
This method does not copy the item specification to the destination task item.
The item that this method will copy metadata to.
Retrieves the specified metadata on the item.
The name of the metadata to retrieve.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents the metadata value.
When overridden in a derived class, gives task items infinite lease time.
Otherwise, a limited lease of 5 minutes will result; and task instances can expire if they take a long time to process.
`null` to specify an infinite lifetime.
Gets or sets the item specification.
The <xref:Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem.ItemSpec%2A> for the following item declaration in a project file is `File.cs`.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents the item specification.
Gets the number of metadata set on the item.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> that represents the count of metadata set on the item.
Gets the names of all the metadata on the item.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> of metadata names.
Removes the specified metadata on the item.
The name of metadata to remove.
Sets or modifies the value of the specified metadata on the item.
The name of metadata to set or modify.
The new value of metadata.
Gets the item specification.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents the item specification.
<xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem2"></xref> implementation which returns a clone of the metadata on this object.
Values returned are in their original escaped form.
Returns the cloned metadata, with values' escaping preserved.
<xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem2"></xref> implementation which gets or sets the item include value.
For disk-based items this would be the file path.
Returns the item include value.
<xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem2"></xref> implementation which allows the values of metadata on the item to be queried.
The metadata to be queried
Returns the escaped metadata value.
<xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem2"></xref> implementation which allows a piece of custom metadata to be set on the item.
Assumes that the value passed in is unescaped, and escapes the value as necessary in order to maintain its value.
The metadata name.
The metadata value.
